contraindication.observationTitle: Severe allergic reaction after previous dose of Meningococcal B
contraindication.contraindicationText: Do not vaccinate if the patient has had a severe allergic reaction after a previous dose of Meningococcal B vaccine.
Do not vaccinate if the patient has had an adverse reaction to a vaccine component.

contraindication.observationTitle: Severe allergic reaction to tetanus toxoid
contraindication.contraindicationText: Do not vaccinate if the patient has had a severe allergic reaction to tetanus toxoid.

contraindication.observationTitle: Severe allergic reaction to diphtheria toxoid
contraindication.contraindicationText: Do not vaccinate if the patient has had a severe allergic reaction to diphtheria toxoid.

series.seriesName: Meningococcal B 2-dose series MenB-4C Shared Clinical Decision Making
seriesAdminGuidance: Delay MenB until after pregnancy due to lack of safety data in pregnant persons. May administer if at increased risk and vaccination benefits outweigh potential risks.

ACIP recommends a MenB vaccine series for persons aged 16-23 years on the basis of shared clinical decision-making to provide short-term protection against most strains of serogroup B meningococcal disease. The preferred age for MenB vaccination is 16-18 years. More guidance can be found here: https://www.cdc.gov/vaccines/hcp/admin/downloads/ISD-job-aid-SCDM-mening-b-shared-clinical-decision-making.pdf
People desiring more rapid protection against serogroup B (e.g., students with less than 6 months before college entry) may receive a 3-dose series (0, 1-2, 6 months) to optimize rapid protection.
Penmenvy (MenACWY/MenB - GSK) may be used when both MenACWY and MenB are indicated at the same visit.

series.seriesName: Meningococcal B 2-dose series MenB-FHbp Shared Clinical Decision Making
seriesAdminGuidance: Delay MenB until after pregnancy due to lack of safety data in pregnant persons. May administer if at increased risk and vaccination benefits outweigh potential risks.

ACIP recommends a MenB vaccine series for persons aged 16-23 years on the basis of shared clinical decision-making to provide short-term protection against most strains of serogroup B meningococcal disease. The preferred age for MenB vaccination is 16-18 years. More guidance can be found here: https://www.cdc.gov/vaccines/hcp/admin/downloads/ISD-job-aid-SCDM-mening-b-shared-clinical-decision-making.pdf
People desiring more rapid protection against serogroup B (e.g., students with less than 6 months before college entry) may receive a 3-dose series (0, 1-2, 6 months) to optimize rapid protection.
Penbraya (MenABCWY - Pfizer) may be used when both MenACWY and MenB are indicated at the same visit.

set.setDescription: Dose is not required once 6 months has passed since the previous dose

series.seriesName: Meningococcal B risk 3-dose series MenB-4C increased risk
seriesAdminGuidance: Delay MenB until after pregnancy due to lack of safety data in pregnant persons. May administer if at increased risk and vaccination benefits outweigh potential risks.
Penmenvy (MenACWY/MenB - GSK) may be used when both MenACWY and MenB are indicated at the same visit.

indication.description: Administered to persons who are undergoing elective splenectomy if they have not previously received Meningococcal B vaccine.
indication.guidance: Vaccination 14 or more days before splenectomy is suggested.

observationCode.text: Microbiologists routinely exposed to Neisseria meningitidis

indication.description: Administer to microbiologists routinely exposed to isolates of Neisseria meningitidis.

observationCode.text: Persons at risk during an outbreak

indication.description: Administer to persons identified as at increased risk because of a serogroup B meningococcal disease outbreak

observationCode.text: Persistent complement, properdin, or factor B deficiency

indication.description: Administer to persons who have persistent complement component deficiencies, including inherited or chronic deficiencies in C3, C5-9, properdin, factor D, factor H, or who are taking eculizumab (Soliris).
Administer to persons with anatomic or functional asplenia, including sickle cell disease.
Administer to persons with sickle cell disease

set.setDescription: Dose is not required once 6 months has passed since the previous dose
Dose is not required if the patient received a valid 2-dose series under previous licensure

series.seriesName: Meningococcal B risk 3-dose series MenB-FHbp Increased Risk
seriesAdminGuidance: Delay MenB until after pregnancy due to lack of safety data in pregnant persons. May administer if at increased risk and vaccination benefits outweigh potential risks.

indication.description: Administer to microbiologists routinely exposed to isolates of Neisseria meningitidis.

observationCode.text: Persons at risk during an outbreak

indication.description: Administer to persons identified as at increased risk because of a serogroup B meningococcal disease outbreak

observationCode.text: Persistent complement, properdin, or factor B deficiency

indication.description: Administer to persons 10 years or older with persistent complement component deficiencies, including inherited or chronic deficiencies in C3, C5-9, properdin, factor D, factor H, or who are taking eculizumab (Soliris).
Administer to persons with anatomic or functional asplenia, including sickle cell disease.
Administer to persons with sickle cell disease
